DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specification/clarification regarding he investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms of a benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation in the triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium, which is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg, with metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions, and is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms of a benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation in the triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium, which is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg, with metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions, and is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
